meanings.definition: Existing or occurring at the same time
meanings.sent1: The two friends were coevally born on the same day.
meanings.sent2: The coevally blooming flowers painted a beautiful scene in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The coevally synchronized dance moves of the performers impressed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The coevally ticking clocks in the room created a symphony of time.
meanings.sent5: The coevally changing seasons marked the passage of time with colorful transitions.

meanings.definition: In a coeval manner or fashion
meanings.sent1: The siblings worked coevally to finish their chores quickly.
meanings.sent2: The team members coevally completed the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: The birds chirped coevally, creating a harmonious melody in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The dancers moved coevally across the stage, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The students answered the questions coevally, showing their unity in knowledge.
